task:
I need to create a professional employment offer letter and then add reviewer comments to specific sections. The letter should contain:

"EMPLOYMENT OFFER LETTER

Dear Alex Thompson,

We are pleased to offer you the position of Senior Software Engineer at DataFlow Systems Inc.

Position Details:
Title: Senior Software Engineer
Department: Engineering
Start Date: June 1, 2024
Reporting To: Director of Engineering

Compensation:
Base Salary: $125,000 per year
Sign-on Bonus: $10,000 (paid with first paycheck)
Annual Performance Bonus: Up to 15% of base salary

Benefits:
- Health insurance (medical, dental, vision)
- 401(k) with 4% company match
- 15 days PTO annually
- Remote work flexibility (2 days per week)

Equity:
You will be granted 5,000 stock options with a 4-year vesting schedule and 1-year cliff.

This offer is contingent upon successful completion of a background check and reference verification.

Please sign and return this letter by May 15, 2024 to indicate your acceptance.

Sincerely,
Michael Chen
VP of Human Resources"

After creating the document, add the following comments:
1. Comment on '$125,000 per year' by HR Manager Lisa Wong: 'Salary is at top of band. Approved by compensation committee.'
2. Comment on 'Remote work flexibility (2 days per week)' by Director Karen Martinez: 'Confirm this aligns with new hybrid policy starting Q3.'
3. Comment on '5,000 stock options' by CFO David Park: 'Stock option grant requires board approval at next meeting.'
4. Comment on 'May 15, 2024' by Recruiter James Wilson: 'Candidate requested extension to May 20. Need to update.'

Finally, extract and display all comments with their locations, authors, and the text they reference to verify they were properly added.
rubric_task_completion:
1. A .docx document is created containing the complete employment offer letter text with proper structure including all sections (Position Details, Compensation, Benefits, Equity, contingency clause, and signature block).
2. Exactly four comments are added to the document at the specified locations: on the salary amount, remote work flexibility clause, stock options amount, and acceptance deadline date.
3. Each comment has the correct author name and comment text as specified in the task.
4. All comments are extracted from the document and displayed with their reference text, author, and comment content, demonstrating successful comment embedding and retrieval.
rubric_skill_use:
1. The document-skills/docx skill is selected to handle the task of creating a Word document with embedded comments and extracting those comments.
2. The SKILL.md file for document-skills/docx is loaded to understand the workflow for creating documents and working with comments.
3. Additional files are appropriately loaded: docx-js.md is read for creating the initial document, ooxml.md is read for understanding comment structure, scripts/document.py and scripts/utilities.py are used for comment manipulation, and the comment template files (comments.xml, commentsExtended.xml, etc.) are utilized for proper comment formatting.
4. The skill's workflow is correctly followed: first creating a new document using docx-js patterns, then unpacking it to add comments using the Document library with proper XML structure, packing the modified document, and finally extracting comments to verify successful implementation.
